channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024050140
item.description:
Report X-2024050140

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package handler noticed a strong odor coming from hazmat package and informed management. QA-Admin was called to collect the package and placed it inside a hazmat bag with absorbent, and bag was placed inside a hazmat tote. Package was brought to vent. Upon further investigation the QA discovered one of the bottles had a loose cap and entire contents leaked out of one bottle.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND, LEAKING ON THE IR-1 BELT, FROM UNLOAD. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED, AREA WAS CLEANED, AND PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKER FOR UNLOAD, UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTICED A CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABEL, FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE TO CLEAN UP SPILLAGE. THEN RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AND FOLLOWED THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024041355
item.description:
Report X-2024041355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: John Houle, 151 Operation Supervisor, advised Safety of a UN1133, Adhesives, 3, PG II spill on the trailer floor. John stated Curtis Baker was unloading the trailer when a box fell off the pallet causing the spill. Safety advised John that Cura will be called for remediation. Safety reviewed the pho tos showing the LTD QTY labels on the pallet behind the spill and called John back to confirm what spilled in the trailer before contacting CURA. John confirmed it was UN1133.

item.title: Report X-2024041213
item.description:
Report X-2024041213

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: ALISO VIEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN A SPILL TRAY INSIDE THE DMP CAGE. RESPONDER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING DUE TO A STAIN ON THE SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. ONCE PACKAGE WAS OPENED FOUND ONE CONTAINER OUT OF 2 BROKEN. RESPONDER PROCEEDED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP AND USED A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM TO RETURN THE UNDAMAGED PRODUCT.
